member.name: IColumnProvider.GetColumnInfo
member.param: The column's zero-based index. It is an arbitrary value that is used to enumerate columns.
A pointer to an structure to hold the column information.

returns.para: Returns a COM error value to indicate that the request was unsuccessful or one of the following values.

member.name: IColumnProvider.GetItemData
member.summary: Requests column data for a specified file.
member.param: An SHCOLUMNID structure that identifies the column.
An structure that specifies the file.

A pointer to a VARIANT with the data for the file specified by pscd that belongs in the column specified by pscid. Set this value if the file is a member of the class supported by the column provider.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if file data is returned, S_FALSE if the file is not supported by the column provider and no data is returned, or a COM error value otherwise.

member.name: IColumnProvider.Initialize
member.param: An structure with initialization information, including the folder whose contents are to be displayed.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Exposes methods that enable the addition of custom columns in the Windows Explorer Details view.
summary.div: Note Support for IColumnProvider has been removed as of Windows Vista. The Windows property system is used in its place. See Windows Property System for conceptual materials that explain the use of the new system.
